summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from August 2019 containing inmate messages sent to a prison work assignment (Plumbing). The messages show an inmate complaining about ineffective medication with side effects, accusing medical staff of negligence, and explicitly connecting their frustration to the Jeffrey Epstein case, hoping staff involved in 'Epstein's neglect' are fired.

persons.name: Dr. B
persons.context: A psychiatrist or doctor referenced by the inmate as following their case and being informed by other staff about medication non-compliance.

events.title: Inmate Medication Complaint
events.description: An inmate sends an angry message to the plumbing work assignment, complaining that prescribed medication causes migraines and a metallic taste, and accusing medical staff of deciding medication without seeing or talking to them.

events.title: Psychiatrist Message on Non-Compliance
events.description: A psychiatrist (or message from one) informs the inmate they have been non-compliant with medication despite education from health services, and advises them to reach out via sick call.

events.title: Inmate Accusation Relating to Epstein
events.description: The inmate forwards the message chain, adding a comment praying the staff member is involved with 'epsteins neglect' and gets fired.

keyFacts: The document is dated August 14, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
An inmate explicitly references 'epsteins neglect,' indicating awareness of and anger over the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death while in custody.
The communication reveals inmate frustration with the prison medical system, including claims of being prescribed ineffective medication with side effects without proper consultation.
The inmate's message suggests a belief among the prison population that staff negligence was involved in Epstein's death and that such staff should be fired.
